gurmukhi: piRQm ibpwsw nwm ly eysrwsqR puin BwKu ] nwm skl sRI pwNs ky cIn ic`q mY rwKu ]326]
transliteration: Pritham Bipaasaa Naam Lai Estaastra Poun(i) Bhaakh(u)|| Naam Sakal Sripaans Kecheen Chitt Mai Raakh(i)||326||
translation: Naming the river “Vipaasha” in the beginning and then saying “Aishraastra”, the names of Paash are known in mind.326.

gurmukhi: rwvI swvI Awid kih AwXuD eys bKwn ] nwm pwNs ky hoq hYN cInhu pRgXwvwn ]327]
transliteration: Raavisaaviaadh Kah(i) Aayudh Es Bakhaan|| Naam Paans Ke Hot Hain Cheenoh Pragyaavaan||327||
translation: Saying primarily the names of river “Raavi” in the beginning and then uttering “Aayudh”, the talented people recognize the names of Paash.327.

gurmukhi: sweIvI sRwvI sBin AwXuD bhur aucwr ] nwm pwNs ky hoq hYN lIjhu su kib suDwr ]328]
transliteration: Saaeevisraavisabhan(i) Aayudh Bahur Ouchaar|| Naam Paans Ke Hot Hain Leejoh Su Kabi Sudhaar||328||
translation: Naming firstly the Lord of all the rivers and then uttering “Aayudh” the poets know correctly all the names of Paash.328.

gurmukhi: jl isMD eys bKwin kY AwXuD AMq bKwn ] nwm pwNs ky hoq hYN cqur icq mih jwn ]329]
transliteration: Jal Sindh Es Bakhaan(i) Kai Aayudh Ant Bakhaan|| Naam Paans Ke Hot Hain Chatur Chit Maih Jaan||329||
translation: Saying “Jal Sindhu Ish” and then uttering “Aayudh” at the end, the wise people know the names of Paash.329.

gurmukhi: ibhiQ Awid Sbdocir kY eysrwsqR khu AMq ] skl nwm ey pwNs ky cIn lyhu miqvMq ]330]
transliteration: Bihath(i) Aadh Shabdochar(i) Kai Esraastra Kaho Ant|| Sakal Naam E Paans Ke Cheen Leh(i) Mat(i)vant||330||
translation: Uttering the word “Vihath” in the beginning and then saying “Aishraastra” at the end, the wise people know the names of Paash.330.

gurmukhi: isMD Awid Sbducir kY AwXuD AMq bKwn ] nwm pwNs ky hoq sB cInhu pRgXwvwn ]331]
transliteration: Sindh Aad Shabdouchar(i) Kai Aayudh Ant Bakhaan|| Naam Paans Ke Hot Sabh Cheenoh Pragyaavaan||331||
translation: Uttering primarily the word “Sindhu” and then saying the word “Aayudh” at the end, the talented people know the names of Paash.331.

gurmukhi: nIl Awid Sbducir kY eysr AsqR bKwn ] nwm pwNs ky hoq hYN cIn lyhu sur igAwn ]332]
transliteration: Neel Aadh Shabdouchar(i) Kai Esar Astra Bakhaan|| Naam Paans Ke Hot Hain Cheen Leh(u) Sur Giaan||332||
translation: Saying primarily the word “Neet” and then uttering “Ishraastrra”, the names of Paash are recognized.332.

gurmukhi: Aisq bwr Sbdwid kih piq AsqRwNq bKwn ] nwm pwNs ky hoq hYN cIn lyhu miqvwn ]333]
transliteration: Asit Baar Shabdaadh Kah(i) Pat(i) Astraant Bakhaan|| Naam Paans Ke Hot Hain Cheen Leh(u) Mat(i)vaan||333||
translation: Uttering the word “Asitvari” in the beginning and then adding “Pati Astar” at the end, O wise ones ! Recognise the names of Paash.333.

gurmukhi: ikSnw Awid aucwir kY AwXuD eys bKwn ] nwm pwNs ky hoq hYN lIjhu cqur pCwn ]334]
transliteration: Kishnaa Aadh Oucdaar(i) Kai Aayudh Es Bakhaan|| Naam Paans Ke Hot Hain Leejoh Chatur Pachhaad||314||
translation: Saying “Krishna” primarily and then uttering “Aayudh Ish”, O wise people ! Recognise the names of Paash.334.

gurmukhi: Sbd Awid kih BImrwie srwsqR kih AMq ] nwm pwNs ky hoq hY cIn lyhu mqvMq ]335]
transliteration: Shabad Aadh Kah(i) Bheemraae Saraastra Kah(i) Ant|| Naam Paans Ke Hot Hai Cheen Leh(u) Matvant||335||
translation: Uttering firstly the word “Bheemraaj” and sayind “Sharastra” at the end, O wise ones ! recognize the names of Paash.335.

gurmukhi: qpqI Awid aucwir kY AwXuD eys bKwn ] nwm pwNs ky hoq hY sujin s`iq kir jwn ]336]
transliteration: Taptiaadh Ouchaar Kai Aayudh Es Bakhaan|| Naam Paans Ke Hot Hai Sujan(i) Satt(i) Kar(i) Jaan||336||
translation: Uttering “Taapti” in the beginning and then adding “Aayudh Ish”, O wise ones ! the names of Paash are known.336.

gurmukhi: bwr rwj smu dys Bin srq srD piq BwKu ] AwXuD puin kih pwNs ky cIn nwm icq rwKu ]337]
transliteration: Baar Raaj Sam(u) Des Bhan(i) Sarat Saradh Pat(i) Bhaakh(u)|| Aayudh Poun(i) Kah(i) Paans Ke Cheen Naam Chit Raakh||337||
translation: Saying “Vaariraaj Samudresh” and then “Sarit-sardhpati” and afterwards “Aayudh”, the names of Paash are known in mind.337.

gurmukhi: brx bIrhw Awid kih AwXuD puin pd dyhu ] nwm pwNs ky hoq hYN cIn cqur icq lyhu ]338]
transliteration: Baran Beer-haa Aadh Kah(i) Aayudh Poun(i) Pad Deh(u)|| Naam Paans Ke Hot Hain Cheen Chatur Chit Leh(u)||338||
translation: Saying “Varun Veerhaa” in the beginning and then adding “Aayudh”, the names of Paash are formed.338.

gurmukhi: ndI rwj srqI sBin smuMdrwt puin BwKu ] AwXuD AMq bKwnIAY nwm pwNs liK rwKu ]339]
transliteration: Nadiraaj Sartisabhan(i) Samounndaraat Poun(i) Bhaakh(u)|| Aayudh Ant Bakhaaneeai Naam Paans Lakh(i) Raakh(u)||339||
translation: Saying “Nadi Raj, Sariti and Samund-raat”, the king of rivers and the Lord of all streames, and then uttering “Aayudh” at the end, the names of Paash are known.339.
